intro: Inula subulata, commonly known as the needleleaf inula, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant features narrow, needle-like leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white, powdery wax. Its flowering period occurs in late summer, producing yellow-orange composite flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Inula subulata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
